result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce J. Spahr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$3,915.00-LG.
$240.00- Pawn America
To be paid at the rate of at least $50.00 per month.
Obtain HSED or GED within 2 years of today's date. GFE to maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two, and if not then perform 10 hours community service per week.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
DNA sample.
114 days jail credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime school, work, or combination of at least 30 hours per week. Or if not then perform 10 hours community service per week.

Counseling, treatment, and assessment as deemed appropriate by agent.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
To be paid out of 25% of prison wages.

PLEA 15CF834:
CT 1. (Misd. Theft 943.20(1)(a) Repeater)>> Guilty

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 


COURT ORDERS: EACH COUNT to run concurrent
In 15CF834- 2 years prison (1 year IC & 1 year ES); 176 days credit; CONDITONS of ES: Counseling/Treatment/Assessment as deemed appropriate by agent; Maintain fulltime school/work/or combination of at least 30 hours per week, if not, 10 hours of CS per week; Eligible for CIP program; DNA Sample & Surcharge; CC.

In 14CF984- 
CT 1: 9 years Prison (3 years IC & 6 years ES); 290 days jail credit; CONDITONS of ES: Counseling/Treatment/Assessment as deemed appropriate by agent; Maintain fulltime school/work/or combination of at least 30 hours per week, if not, 10 hours of CS per week; Eligible for CIP program; DNA Sample & Surcharge; CC; Restitution in amount of $3869.28 (Payment of restitution- to be paid out of up to 25% of prison wages).
CT 3: 5 years Prison (2 years IC & 3 year ES); 290 days jail credit; CONDITONS of ES: Counseling/Treatment/Assessment as deemed appropriate by agent; Maintain fulltime school/work/or combination of at least 30 hours per week, if not, 10 hours of CS per week; Eligible for CIP program; DNA Sample & Surcharge; CC; Restitution in amount of $3869.28 (Payment of restitution- to be paid out of up to 25% of prison wages).

COURT finds the deft is entitled to 114 days jail credit if revoked. 
Counsel to retain copies of PSI and maintain its confidentiality.

$10,000.00 W/ FRIST $2,500.00 CASH (must be co-signed by at least one parent.   No contact with victim(s): J.G., P.S., & M.G. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.
